description:
It has everything I am looking for in software tailored towards writers. It's able to organise projects in chapters and scenes and displays your writing in a visually pleasant way. There are no distracting toolbars and it includes a focus mode that curbs distractions even more. For those who care about word count and the likes, the dashboard shows you the total chapter, scene, and word count, and you can also see the word count for every scene.
This application is still in development and will most certainly become a free alternative to some of the more expensive pieces of writing software such as Scrivener. It is being actively developed so I am looking forward to great things from this little gem!
summary: OmniaWrite is an application with a ton of potential

description: Really like it so far, especially the modern user interface!
Installed it (18.04), clicked Launch and nothing happened. Selected it from app menu, nothing happened. Checked permissions and all OK but this just does nothing. Uninstalled it.

It looks great, and the process of setting up a framework is as simple and intuitive as it could be. I have got used to Plume, a very different looking beast. This looks better.
However, for now, it's not for me. It's tied to a cloud service or local files are kept in a browser folder. You have to export to have a copy of your files outside the app. 
If it could be set up so that users can save to their own chosen folder (I have my own cloud set up, for instance) I think it would tempt me from Plume.

The description claims "everything you need". However, there seems to be no way to get existing pieces of text in an out of this app, which I would have thought most people would really want?
The apps seems to be based around someone's specific use case, rather than a global tool. I accept that it is early in development, and look forward to it becoming useful as a writing tool ...
summary: Unusual app .. quite dated, or am I missing something?

description: It's pretty rubbish, it doesn't save properly so you'll keep losing your work if you jump back and forth between chapters. No errors or anything, but the last paragraphs of the chapter you were working on will just be gone when you switch back to it. Wouldn't recommend it.

I was looking for a great writing tool for Linux (writing a book, at chapter 4 now), and this OmniaWrite application is a dream. Intuitive, works well, great looking and has all the settigns I could need. 

Devs...it is fantastic!
In current times it's way to common to have this feature, and if it isnt available it should be mentioned, or at least user should be asked if he is sure to lose all his progress. Wouldn't recommend.
summary: Wrote whole section, program didn't autosave it and removed it

description: I started writing and only soon discovered that after almost writing a full chapter after almost a week's writer's block that I had lost the whole writing because I switched back and forth chapters. I can no longer write because I think I have finally lost the zeal.
summary: You might pull out your hair

description: Does what is expected. There could be more flexibility in the organization of Project > Chapter > Scene - but I bet they're already working on it.
broke it already only created one chapter.
summary: i was toying with it and now its broken

description: I think absolutely NOTHING about this app.

AUTO SAVE IS NOW AVAILABLE IN 2022 MARCH

FEATURES ARE GREAT

To create a new chapter, use a little (+) button on the bottom.

Actually, can't work in 100% full-screen mode.
es mejor que tomen copias de respaldo en otras aplicaciones ya que no suele ser muy fiable el sistema de guardado y se puede perder la inforamacion
Le logiciel semble bien réalisé, mais pour un amoureux de la langue française il sera déçu de constaté que ce n'est pas une langue supportée par OmniaWrite.
summary: Application qui n'a pas était traduit pour des auteurs francophones

description:
На первый взгляд всё неплохо, для упорядочивания своей работы то что надо. На сколько я понял, можно прямо в приложении экспортировать работу в формат epub. Радует, что есть русский язык, прям очень радует.
Но может туплю (в чем сомневаюсь), я не нашел возможности изменить шрифт. Жирный, курсив и подчеркивание это хорошо, но вот сам стиль не изменить
